2025.context: Okta, Inc. is a identity and access management company focused on workforce identity, customer identity, and privileged access. Identity platform leader. Competing with Microsoft, CyberArk.

competitors.name: OneLogin
competitors.notes: Top alternative with 42.62% market share. Often described as 'Okta-lite' in a good way. Offers all IAM essentials (SSO, MFA, user provisioning, policy management) with simpler UI and faster time to value. Largest competitor by market share.

competitors.name: Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure AD)
competitors.notes: Strongest competitor, particularly for organizations invested in Microsoft ecosystem. Enterprise-grade identity and access management platform offering unified solution for managing identities across hybrid and cloud environments. Entra ID P2 is $9/user/month, Entra ID Suite is $12/user/month. Plans often included in Microsoft 365 subscriptions.

competitors.name: Duo Security
competitors.notes: Second in market share at 3.19%. Strong in multi-factor authentication and zero trust security, now part of Cisco ecosystem offering integrated security solutions.

competitors.name: Rippling IT
competitors.notes: Emerging as strong competitor offering granular access controls across user lifecycle and holistic approach to global workforce management. Innovative alternative to traditional IAM leaders.

competitors.name: JumpCloud
competitors.notes: Cloud-native solution offering extensive device authentication and configuration policies. Starts at $13 per user per month with annual billing. Limited SSO capabilities and requires complex configurations but strong in device management.

competitors.name: CyberArk
competitors.notes: Known for intuitive interface and privileged access management. Offers MFA and self-hosting options that integrate easily with other security solutions. Best for large enterprises requiring robust access controls and data security management. Limited reporting features.

competitors.name: Auth0
competitors.notes: Now part of Okta but available as standalone platform. Developer-centric identity platform focused on flexibility and customization. Chosen by organizations needing to embed secure authentication into custom applications. Caters to product teams, startups, and enterprises prioritizing developer experience.

competitors.name: Silverfort
competitors.notes: Comprehensive identity security solution extending across on-premises, cloud, and hybrid environments. Robust MFA, Identity Threat Detection and Response (ITDR), SSO capabilities, and adaptive deny policies. Best for organizations seeking unified solution to enforce security across cloud and on-premises seamlessly.

competitors.name: Gigya
competitors.notes: Third in market share at 3.11%. Focuses on customer identity and access management (CIAM) with strong capabilities in user registration, authentication, and profile management.
